test.question: Which of the following is part of the Basis and Purpose of the Amateur Radio Service?
test.A: A. Providing personal radio communications for as many citizens as possible
test.B: B. Providing communications for international non-profit organizations
test.C: C. Advancing skills in the technical and communication phases of the radio art
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: Which agency regulates and enforces the rules for the Amateur Radio Service in the United States?
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: What do the FCC rules state regarding the use of a phonetic alphabet for station identification in the Amateur Radio Service?
test.A: A. It is required when transmitting emergency messages
test.C: C. It is required when in contact with foreign stations
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: How many operator/primary station license grants may be held by any one person?
test.C: C. One for each band on which the person plans to operate
test.D: D. One for each permanent station location from which the person plans to operate

test.question: What proves that the FCC has issued an operator/primary license grant?
test.A: A. A printed copy of the certificate of successful completion of examination
test.B: B. An email notification from the NCVEC granting the license
test.C: C. The license appears in the FCC ULS database
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: What is the FCC Part 97 definition of a beacon?
test.A: A. A government transmitter marking the amateur radio band edges
test.B: B. A bulletin sent by the FCC to announce a national emergency
test.C: C. A continuous transmission of weather information authorized in the amateur bands by the National Weather Service
test.D: D. An amateur station transmitting communications for the purposes of observing propagation or related experimental activities

test.question: What is the FCC Part 97 definition of a space station?
test.B: B. A manned satellite orbiting Earth
test.C: C. An amateur station located more than 50 km above Earth's surface
test.D: D. An amateur station using amateur radio satellites for relay of signals

test.question: Which of the following entities recommends transmit/receive channels and other parameters for auxiliary and repeater stations?
test.A: A. Frequency Spectrum Manager appointed by the FCC
test.B: B. Volunteer Frequency Coordinator recognized by local amateurs
test.D: D. International Telecommunication Union

test.question: Who selects a Frequency Coordinator?
test.A: A. The FCC Office of Spectrum Management and Coordination Policy
test.B: B. The local chapter of the Office of National Council of Independent Frequency Coordinators
test.C: C. Amateur operators in a local or regional area whose stations are eligible to be repeater or auxiliary stations
test.D: D. FCC Regional Field Office

test.question: What is the Radio Amateur Civil Emergency Service (RACES)?
test.A: A. A radio service using amateur frequencies for emergency management or civil defense communications
test.B: B. A radio service using amateur stations for emergency management or civil defense communications
test.C: C. An emergency service using amateur operators certified by a civil defense organization as being enrolled in that organization
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: When is willful interference to other amateur radio stations permitted?
test.A: A. To stop another amateur station that is breaking the FCC rules
test.C: C. When making short test transmissions
test.D: D. At any time, stations in the Amateur Radio Service are not protected from willful interference

test.question: Which of the following frequency ranges are available for phone operation by Technician licensees?
test.D: D. 28.500 MHz to 28.600 MHz

test.question: Which amateurs may contact the International Space Station (ISS), on VHF bands?
test.A: A. Any amateur holding a General class or higher license
test.B: B. Any amateur holding a Technician class or higher license
test.C: C. Any amateur holding a General class or higher license who has applied for and received approval from NASA
test.D: D. Any amateur holding a Technician class or higher license who has applied for and received approval from NASA

test.question: Which frequency is in the 6 meter amateur band?
Which amateur band includes 146.52 MHz?
test.D: D. 2 meters

test.question: How may amateurs use the 219 to 220 MHz segment of 1.25 meter band?
test.D: D. Fixed digital message forwarding systems only

test.question: On which HF bands does a Technician class operator have phone privileges?
test.C: C. 80 meter, 40 meter, 15 meter, and 10 meter bands
test.D: D. 30 meter band only

test.question: Which of the following VHF/UHF band segments are limited to CW only?
test.A: A. 50.0 MHz to 50.1 MHz and 144.0 MHz to 144.1 MHz
test.B: B. 219 MHz to 220 MHz and 420.0 MHz to 420.1 MHz
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: How are US amateurs restricted in segments of bands where the Amateur Radio Service is secondary?
test.A: A. U.S. amateurs may find non-amateur stations in those segments, and must avoid interfering with them
test.B: B. U.S. amateurs must give foreign amateur stations priority in those segments
test.C: C. International communications are not permitted in those segments
test.D: D. Digital transmissions are not permitted in those segments

test.question: Why should you not set your transmit frequency to be exactly at the edge of an amateur band or sub-band?
test.A: A. To allow for calibration error in the transmitter frequency display
test.B: B. So that modulation sidebands do not extend beyond the band edge
test.C: C. To allow for transmitter frequency drift
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: Where may SSB phone be used in amateur bands above 50 MHz?
test.A: A. Only in sub-bands allocated to General class or higher licensees
test.C: C. In at least some segment of all these bands
test.D: D. On any band if the power is limited to 25 watts

test.question: What is the maximum peak envelope power output for Technician class operators in their HF band segments?
test.D: D. 10 watts

test.question: Except for some specific restrictions, what is the maximum peak envelope power output for Technician class operators using frequencies above 30 MHz?
test.D: D. 1500 watts

test.question: For which license classes are new licenses currently available from the FCC?
test.A: A. Novice, Technician, General, Amateur Extra
test.B: B. Technician, Technician Plus, General, Amateur Extra
test.C: C. Novice, Technician Plus, General, Advanced
test.D: D. Technician, General, Amateur Extra

test.question: Who may select a desired call sign under the vanity call sign rules?
test.A: A. Only a licensed amateur with a General or Amateur Extra Class license
test.B: B. Only a licensed amateur with an Amateur Extra Class license
test.C: C. Only a licensed amateur who has been licensed continuously for more than 10 years
test.D: D. Any licensed amateur

test.question: What types of international communications are an FCC-licensed amateur radio station permitted to make?
test.A: A. Communications incidental to the purposes of the Amateur Radio Service and remarks of a personal character
test.B: B. Communications incidental to conducting business or remarks of a personal nature
test.C: C. Only communications incidental to contest exchanges; all other communications are prohibited
test.D: D. Any communications that would be permitted by an international broadcast station

test.question: What may happen if the FCC is unable to reach you by email?
test.A: A. Fine and suspension of operator license
test.B: B. Revocation of the station license or suspension of the operator license
test.C: C. Revocation of access to the license record in the FCC system
test.D: D. Nothing; there is no such requirement

test.question: Which of the following is a valid Technician class call sign format?
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: From which of the following locations may an FCC-licensed amateur station transmit?
test.A: A. From within any country that belongs to the International Telecommunication Union
test.B: B. From within any country that is a member of the United Nations
test.C: C. From anywhere within International Telecommunication Union (ITU), Regions 2 and 3
test.D: D. From any vessel or craft located in international waters and documented or registered in the United States

test.question: Which of the following can result in revocation of the station license or suspension of the operator license?
test.A: A. Failure to inform the FCC of any changes in the amateur station following performance of an RF safety environmental evaluation
test.B: B. Failure to provide and maintain a correct email address with the FCC
test.C: C. Failure to obtain FCC type acceptance prior to using a home-built transmitter
test.D: D. Failure to have a copy of your license available at your station

test.question: What is the normal term for an FCC-issued amateur radio license?
test.D: D. Eight years

test.question: What is the grace period for renewal if an amateur license expires?
test.D: D. Ten years

test.question: How soon after passing the examination for your first amateur radio license may you transmit on the amateur radio bands?
test.A: A. Immediately on receiving your Certificate of Successful Completion of Examination (CSCE)
test.B: B. As soon as your operator/station license grant appears on the ARRL website
test.C: C. As soon as your operator/station license grant appears in the FCCâ€™s license database
test.D: D. As soon as you receive your license in the mail from the FCC

test.question: If your license has expired and is still within the allowable grace period, may you continue to transmit on the amateur radio bands?
test.A: A. Yes, for up to two years
test.B: B. Yes, as soon as you apply for renewal
test.C: C. Yes, for up to one year
test.D: D. No, you must wait until the license has been renewed

test.question: With which countries are FCC-licensed amateur radio stations prohibited from exchanging communications?
test.A: A. Any country whose administration has notified the International Telecommunication Union (ITU), that it objects to such communications
test.B: B. Any country whose administration has notified the American Radio Relay League (ARRL), that it objects to such communications
test.C: C. Any country banned from such communications by the International Amateur Radio Union (IARU)
test.D: D. Any country banned from making such communications by the American Radio Relay League (ARRL)

test.question: Under which of the following circumstances are one-way transmissions by an amateur station prohibited?
test.D: D. Telecommand or transmissions of telemetry

test.question: When is it permissible to transmit messages encoded to obscure their meaning?
test.B: B. Only when transmitting certain approved digital codes
test.C: C. Only when transmitting control commands to space stations or radio control craft
test.D: D. Never

test.question: Under what conditions is an amateur station authorized to transmit music using a phone emission?
test.A: A. When incidental to an authorized retransmission of manned spacecraft communications
test.B: B. When the music produces no spurious emissions
test.C: C. When transmissions are limited to less than three minutes per hour
test.D: D. When the music is transmitted above 1280 MHz

test.question: When may amateur radio operators use their stations to notify other amateurs of the availability of equipment for sale or trade?
test.B: B. When the equipment is not the personal property of either the station licensee, or the control operator, or their close relatives
test.C: C. When no profit is made on the sale
test.D: D. When selling amateur radio equipment and not on a regular basis

test.question: What, if any, are the restrictions concerning transmission of language that may be considered indecent or obscene?
test.A: A. The FCC maintains a list of words that are not permitted to be used on amateur frequencies
test.B: B. Any such language is prohibited
test.C: C. The ITU maintains a list of words that are not permitted to be used on amateur frequencies
test.D: D. There is no such prohibition

test.question: What types of amateur stations can automatically retransmit the signals of other amateur stations?
test.A: A. Auxiliary, beacon, or Earth stations
test.B: B. Earth, repeater, or space stations
test.C: C. Beacon, repeater, or space stations
test.D: D. Repeater, auxiliary, or space stations

test.question: In which of the following circumstances may the control operator of an amateur station receive compensation for operating that station?
test.A: A. When the communication is related to the sale of amateur equipment by the control operator's employer
test.B: B. When the communication is incidental to classroom instruction at an educational institution
test.C: C. When the communication is made to obtain emergency information for a local broadcast station
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: When may amateur stations transmit information in support of broadcasting, program production, or news gathering, assuming no other means is available?
test.A: A. When such communications are directly related to the immediate safety of human life or protection of property
test.B: B. When broadcasting communications to or from the space shuttle
test.C: C. Where noncommercial programming is gathered and supplied exclusively to the National Public Radio network
test.D: D. Never

test.question: How does the FCC define broadcasting for the Amateur Radio Service?
test.A: A. Two-way transmissions by amateur stations
test.B: B. Any transmission made by the licensed station
test.C: C. Transmission of messages directed only to amateur operators
test.D: D. Transmissions intended for reception by the general public

test.question: When may an amateur station transmit without identifying on the air?
test.A: A. When the transmissions are of a brief nature to make station adjustments
test.B: B. When the transmissions are unmodulated
test.C: C. When the transmitted power level is below 1 watt
test.D: D. When transmitting signals to control model craft

test.question: When may an amateur station transmit without a control operator?
test.A: A. When using automatic control, such as in the case of a repeater
test.B: B. When the station licensee is away and another licensed amateur is using the station
test.C: C. When the transmitting station is an auxiliary station
test.D: D. Never

test.question: Who may be the control operator of a station communicating through an amateur satellite or space station?
test.A: A. Only an Amateur Extra Class operator
test.B: B. A General class or higher licensee with a satellite operator certification
test.C: C. Only an Amateur Extra Class operator who is also an AMSAT member
test.D: D. Any amateur allowed to transmit on the satellite uplink frequency

test.question: Who must designate the station control operator?
test.D: D. Any licensed operator

test.question: What determines the transmitting frequency privileges of an amateur station?
test.A: A. The frequency authorized by the frequency coordinator
test.B: B. The frequencies printed on the license grant
test.C: C. The highest class of operator license held by anyone on the premises
test.D: D. The class of operator license held by the control operator

test.question: What is an amateur stationâ€™s control point?
test.A: A. The location of the stationâ€™s transmitting antenna
test.B: B. The location of the stationâ€™s transmitting apparatus
test.C: C. The location at which the control operator function is performed
test.D: D. The mailing address of the station licensee

test.question: When, under normal circumstances, may a Technician class licensee be the control operator of a station operating in an Amateur Extra Class band segment?
test.B: B. When designated as the control operator by an Amateur Extra Class licensee
test.C: C. As part of a multi-operator contest team
test.D: D. When using a club station whose trustee holds an Amateur Extra Class license

test.question: When the control operator is not the station licensee, who is responsible for the proper operation of the station?
test.A: A. All licensed amateurs who are present at the operation
test.D: D. The control operator and the station licensee

test.question: Which of the following is an example of automatic control?
test.B: B. Controlling a station over the internet
test.C: C. Using a computer or other device to send CW automatically
test.D: D. Using a computer or other device to identify automatically

test.question: Which of the following are required for remote control operation?
test.A: A. The control operator must be at the control point
test.B: B. A control operator is required at all times
test.C: C. The control operator must indirectly manipulate the controls
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: Which of the following is an example of remote control as defined in Part 97?
test.B: B. Operating the station over the internet
test.C: C. Controlling a model aircraft, boat, or car by amateur radio
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: Who does the FCC presume to be the control operator of an amateur station, unless documentation to the contrary is in the station records?
test.C: C. The person operating the station equipment
test.D: D. The station licensee

test.question: When must the station and its records be available for FCC inspection?
test.A: A. At any time ten days after notification by the FCC of such an inspection
test.B: B. At any time upon request by an FCC representative
test.C: C. At any time after written notification by the FCC of such inspection
test.D: D. Only when presented with a valid warrant by an FCC official or government agent

test.question: How often must you identify with your FCC-assigned call sign when using tactical call signs such as "Race Headquarters"?
test.A: A. Never, the tactical call is sufficient
test.C: C. At the end of each communication and every ten minutes during a communication
test.D: D. At the end of every transmission

test.question: When are you required to transmit your assigned call sign?
test.A: A. At the beginning of each contact, and every 10 minutes thereafter
test.B: B. At least once during each transmission
test.C: C. At least every 15 minutes during and at the end of a communication
test.D: D. At least every 10 minutes during and at the end of a communication

test.question: What language may you use for identification when operating in a phone sub-band?
test.A: A. Any language recognized by the United Nations
test.B: B. Any language recognized by the ITU
test.D: D. English, French, or Spanish

test.question: What method of call sign identification is required for a station transmitting phone signals?
test.A: A. Send the call sign followed by the indicator RPT
test.B: B. Send the call sign using a CW or phone emission
test.C: C. Send the call sign followed by the indicator R
test.D: D. Send the call sign using only a phone emission

test.question: Which of the following self-assigned indicators are acceptable when using a phone transmission?
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: Which of the following restrictions apply when a non-licensed person is allowed to speak to a foreign station using a station under the control of a licensed amateur operator?
test.A: A. The person must be a U.S. citizen
test.B: B. The foreign station must be in a country with which the U.S. has a third party agreement
test.C: C. The licensed control operator must do the station identification
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: What is the definition of third party communications?
test.A: A. A message from a control operator to another amateur station control operator on behalf of another person
test.B: B. Amateur radio communications where three stations are in communications with one another
test.C: C. Operation when the transmitting equipment is licensed to a person other than the control operator
test.D: D. Temporary authorization for an unlicensed person to transmit on the amateur bands for technical experiments

test.question: What type of amateur station simultaneously retransmits the signal of another amateur station on a different channel or channels?
test.D: D. Message forwarding station

test.question: Who is accountable if a repeater inadvertently retransmits communications that violate the FCC rules?
test.A: A. The control operator of the originating station
test.B: B. The control operator of the repeater
test.C: C. The owner of the repeater
test.D: D. Both the originating station and the repeater owner

test.question: Which of the following is a requirement for the issuance of a club station license grant?
test.A: A. The trustee must have an Amateur Extra Class operator license grant
test.B: B. The club must have at least four members
test.C: C. The club must be registered with the American Radio Relay League
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: What is a common repeater frequency offset in the 2 meter band?
test.D: D. Plus or minus 1 MHz

test.question: What is the national calling frequency for FM simplex operations in the 2 meter band?
What is a common repeater frequency offset in the 70 cm band?
test.D: D. Plus or minus 1 MHz

test.question: What is an appropriate way to call another station on a repeater if you know the other station's call sign?
test.A: A. Say "break, break," then say the station's call sign
test.B: B. Say the station's call sign, then identify with your call sign
test.C: C. Say "CQ" three times, then the other station's call sign
test.D: D. Wait for the station to call CQ, then answer

test.question: How should you respond to a station calling CQ?
test.A: A. Transmit "CQ" followed by the other stationâ€™s call sign
test.B: B. Transmit your call sign followed by the other stationâ€™s call sign
test.C: C. Transmit the other stationâ€™s call sign followed by your call sign
test.D: D. Transmit a signal report followed by your call sign

test.question: Which of the following is required when making on-the-air test transmissions?
test.B: B. Conduct tests only between 10 p.m. and 6 a.m. local time
test.C: C. Notify the FCC of the transmissions
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: What is meant by "repeater offset"?
test.A: A. The difference between a repeaterâ€™s transmit and receive frequencies
test.B: B. The repeater has a time delay to prevent interference
test.C: C. The repeater station identification is done on a separate frequency
test.D: D. The number of simultaneous transmit frequencies used by a repeater

test.question: What is the meaning of the procedural signal "CQ"?
test.A: A. Call on the quarter hour
test.B: B. Test transmission, no reply expected
test.C: C. Only the called station should transmit
test.D: D. Calling any station

test.question: Which of the following indicates that a station is listening on a repeater and looking for a contact?
test.A: A. "CQ CQ" followed by the stationâ€™s call sign
test.B: B. The stationâ€™s call sign followed by the word "monitoring"
test.C: C. The repeater call sign followed by the stationâ€™s call sign
test.D: D. "QSY" followed by your call sign

test.question: What is a band plan, beyond the privileges established by the FCC?
test.A: A. A voluntary guideline for using different modes or activities within an amateur band
test.B: B. A list of operating schedules
test.C: C. A list of available net frequencies
test.D: D. A plan devised by a club to indicate frequency band usage

test.question: What term describes an amateur station that is transmitting and receiving on the same frequency?
test.D: D. Multiplex

test.question: What should you do before calling CQ?
test.A: A. Listen first to be sure that no one else is using the frequency
test.B: B. Ask if the frequency is in use
test.C: C. Make sure you are authorized to use that frequency
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: How is a VHF/UHF transceiverâ€™s "reverse" function used?
test.C: C. To listen on a repeaterâ€™s input frequency
test.D: D. To listen on a repeaterâ€™s output frequency

test.question: What term describes the use of a sub-audible tone transmitted along with normal voice audio to open the squelch of a receiver?
test.D: D. CTCSS

test.question: Which of the following describes a linked repeater network?
test.A: A. A network of repeaters in which signals received by one repeater are transmitted by all the repeaters in the network
test.B: B. A single repeater with more than one receiver
test.C: C. Multiple repeaters with the same control operator
test.D: D. A system of repeaters linked by APRS

test.question: Which of the following could be the reason you are unable to access a repeater whose output you can hear?
test.B: B. You are using the wrong CTCSS tone
test.C: C. You are using the wrong DCS code
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: What would cause your FM transmission audio to be distorted on voice peaks?
test.A: A. Your repeater offset is inverted
test.B: B. You need to talk louder
test.C: C. You are talking too loudly
test.D: D. Your transmit power is too high

test.question: What type of signaling uses pairs of audio tones?
test.D: D. D-STAR

test.question: How can you join a digital repeaterâ€™s "talkgroup"?
test.A: A. Register your radio with the local FCC office
test.B: B. Join the repeater ownerâ€™s club
test.C: C. Program your radio with the groupâ€™s ID or code
test.D: D. Sign your call after the courtesy tone

test.question: Which of the following applies when two stations transmitting on the same frequency interfere with each other?
test.A: A. The stations should negotiate continued use of the frequency
test.B: B. Both stations should choose another frequency to avoid conflict
test.C: C. Interference is inevitable, so no action is required
test.D: D. Use subaudible tones so both stations can share the frequency

test.question: Why are simplex channels designated in the VHF/UHF band plans?
test.A: A. So stations within range of each other can communicate without tying up a repeater
test.D: D. So stations with simple transmitters can access the repeater without automated offset

test.question: Which Q signal indicates that you are receiving interference from other stations?
test.D: D. QSB

test.question: Which Q signal indicates that you are changing frequency?
test.D: D. QRZ

test.question: What is the purpose of the color code used on DMR repeater systems?
test.B: B. Defines the frequency pair to use
test.D: D. Defines the minimum signal level required for access

test.question: What is the purpose of a squelch function?
test.A: A. Reduce a CW transmitter's key clicks
test.B: B. Mute the receiver audio when a signal is not present
test.C: C. Eliminate parasitic oscillations in an RF amplifier
test.D: D. Reduce interference from impulse noise

test.question: When do FCC rules NOT apply to the operation of an amateur station?
test.A: A. When operating a RACES station
test.B: B. When operating under special FEMA rules
test.C: C. When operating under special ARES rules
test.D: D. FCC rules always apply

test.question: Which of the following are typical duties of a Net Control Station?
test.A: A. Choose the regular net meeting time and frequency
test.B: B. Ensure that all stations checking into the net are properly licensed for operation on the net frequency
test.C: C. Call the net to order and direct communications between stations checking in
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: What technique is used to ensure that voice messages containing unusual words are received correctly?
test.A: A. Send the words by voice and Morse code
test.B: B. Speak very loudly into the microphone
test.C: C. Spell the words using a standard phonetic alphabet
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: What is RACES?
test.A: A. An emergency organization combining amateur radio and citizens band operators and frequencies
test.B: B. An international radio experimentation society
test.C: C. A radio contest held in a short period, sometimes called a "sprint"
test.D: D. An FCC part 97 amateur radio service for civil defense communications during national emergencies

test.question: What does the term "traffic" refer to in net operation?
test.A: A. Messages exchanged by net stations
test.B: B. The number of stations checking in and out of a net
test.C: C. Operation by mobile or portable stations
test.D: D. Requests to activate the net by a served agency

test.question: What is the Amateur Radio Emergency Service (ARES)?
test.A: A. A group of licensed amateurs who have voluntarily registered their qualifications and equipment for communications duty in the public service
test.B: B. A group of licensed amateurs who are members of the military and who voluntarily agreed to provide message handling services in the case of an emergency
test.C: C. A training program that provides licensing courses for those interested in obtaining an amateur license to use during emergencies
test.D: D. A training program that certifies amateur operators for membership in the Radio Amateur Civil Emergency Service

test.question: Which of the following is standard practice when you participate in a net?
test.A: A. When first responding to the net control station, transmit your call sign, name, and address as in the FCC database
test.B: B. Record the time of each of your transmissions
test.C: C. Unless you are reporting an emergency, transmit only when directed by the net control station
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of good traffic handling?
test.A: A. Passing messages exactly as received
test.B: B. Making decisions as to whether messages are worthy of relay or delivery
test.C: C. Ensuring that any newsworthy messages are relayed to the news media
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: Are amateur station control operators ever permitted to operate outside the frequency privileges of their license class?
test.B: B. Yes, but only when part of a FEMA emergency plan
test.C: C. Yes, but only when part of a RACES emergency plan
test.D: D. Yes, but only in situations involving the immediate safety of human life or protection of property

test.question: What information is contained in the preamble of a formal traffic message?
test.A: A. The email address of the originating station
test.B: B. The address of the intended recipient
test.C: C. The telephone number of the addressee
test.D: D. Information needed to track the message

test.question: What is meant by "check" in a radiogram header?
test.A: A. The number of words or word equivalents in the text portion of the message
test.B: B. The call sign of the originating station
test.C: C. A list of stations that have relayed the message
test.D: D. A box on the message form that indicates that the message was received and/or relayed

test.question: Why do VHF signal strengths sometimes vary greatly when the antenna is moved only a few feet?
test.A: A. The signal path encounters different concentrations of water vapor
test.B: B. VHF ionospheric propagation is very sensitive to path length
test.C: C. Multipath propagation cancels or reinforces signals
test.D: D. All these choices are correct

test.question: What is the effect of vegetation on UHF and microwave signals?
test.D: D. Polarization rotation

test.question: What antenna polarization is normally used for long-distance CW and SSB contacts on the VHF and UHF bands?
test.D: D. Vertical
